Research Article

A Dynamic molecular basis for malfunction in disease mutants of p97/VCP

  • Anne K Schuetz
  • Lewis E Kay

Affiliation details

  • Anne K Schuetz

    Department of Molecular Genetics, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada; Department of Biochemistry, University of Toronto, Toronto, Cananda; Department of Chemistry, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada
    Contribution: Conceived the study, Produced samples, Obtained NMR spectra and analyzed the data, Wrote and edited the paper, Involved in all aspects of the work
    For correspondence: anns@pound.med.utoronto.ca
    No competing interests declared

  • Lewis E Kay

    Department of Molecular Genetics, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada; Department of Biochemistry, University of Toronto, Toronto, Cananda; Department of Chemistry, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada; Program in Molecular Structure and Function, Hospital for Sick Children, Toronto, Canada
    Contribution: Conceived the study, Produced samples, Obtained NMR spectra and analyzed the data, Wrote and edited the paper, Involved in all aspects of the work
    For correspondence: kay@pound.med.utoronto.ca
    : http://orcid.org/0000-0002-4054-4083
    No competing interests declared
University of Toronto, Canada; University of Toronto, Cananda; Hospital for Sick Children, Canada
DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.7554/eLife.20143
Published November 9, 2016

eLife is supported by

eLife Sciences is a unique, non-profit collaboration between the funders and practitioners of research to improve the way important results are presented and shared. The open-access eLife journal is the first step in this initiative to make science publishing more effectively benefit science and scientists.

eLife Sciences Publications, Ltd is a limited liability non-profit non-stock corporation incorporated in the State of Delaware, USA, with company number 5030732, and is registered in the UK with company number FC030576 and branch number BR015634 at the address:
